column8: Comments

System was designed to send historical usage to POLR when customer sent to POLR.  The change to be implemented is that ERCOT will act as the transaction point and will receive the historical data and then send it to POLR upon POLR request.
Currently there is not a profile for DLC and the system cannot currently support the use of this type of profile.
RMR units may not be included in a QSEs Portfolio that is being bid for Ancillary Services.  RMR units must be represented by a "Sub QSE".
Current design does not allow for controllable loads or similar pricing schemes

column3: Load Profiling Models via the API
column8: Current design does not include Load Profiling Models to be available via the API
Backcast profiles are sent to the data archive and available on the second day after the operating day
Current mapping does not reference all historical rate classes
Current design does not include validation tests; ERCOT will perform manual testing

column3: Treatment of nonmetered loads in IDR requirements reporting
column8: Current system design does not have a flag to exclude nonmetered load from IDR requirements reporting
ERCOT and TX SET should be included in the process for changing TOU schedules/periods.

column3: Notification to Current CR of Drop Due to Switch (without date)
column8: The TX SET transaction has not been developed to support this process; not included in current design
The timing in the current Protocol has not been guaranteed by vendor.  Previous versions of the Protocols stated the processing times would be posted on MIS.

column3: Off-cycle meter read request dates, Rejection of switch request
column8: Current design is based on the TDSP sending the first available on-cycle switch date if the CR requests an off-cycle date before the first available switch date
The current system design will not reject an off-cycle switch date preceding a first available switch date
No longer has all the information necessary for the POLR to provide service for the ESI ID
Drop response is only sent within 1 Bus. Day if the Drop Request is invalid
The current version of 814-04 does not include all the required information.  System design based on current 814-04
Current design is to wait until end of customer review period, and then process requests concurrently
The current version of 814-04 does not include all the required information.  System design based on current 814-04
Does not include all the information required.

Multiple owners of a single unit want to be able to split the generation meter for load (auxiliary power).  Currently system does not accommodate split of generation meters.  Protocol allows for load splitting only when all channels of a split meter are scheduled through one REP.
Screens need to be updated to be made relevant for generation outages as well as transmission outages.
Outage Scheduler does not automatically acknowledge receipt of outage request/notification. Needs to do auto acknowledgement email.

column3: Outage Scheduler time and date stamp submissions
column8: Outage Scheduler does not time and date stamp submissions and thus cannot keep track of when submissions are made.  ERCOT personnel have no way to comply with the timelines other than to track submission request dates manually. Needs to have submissions time and date stamped and to allow submissions to be sorted by date submitted to facilitate compliance with response timeline.
System does not create or send tags
Should systematically be able to alter or retract
Design uses loss code; Correcting terms will make the protocol reflect the design and the existing language in other protocol sections

Discussion with market participants revealed that they did not want an individual notification for each ESI-ID that successfully loaded in lodestar - only want notification of failure/rejections.  Need to change protocol to reflect this design.
Current design selects the trade day profile when default profile is used during proxy day routine.  Use of trade day profile is more accurate than use of proxy day profile.
Need consistent variable naming

column3: Identification of transmission voltage customers for IDR requirements
column8: Identification of transmission voltage customers for exclusion from  IDR requirements in not in current design
System is not aggregating into a single ESI-ID…language clarification needed

column3: LSE Load Ratio and loss allocation
column8: MP can use available data to perform calculation of LSE independently; Data remains at aggregate levels throughout process and is made available to MP based on 7-way cut;

column3: Extracts vs. Posting of Meter data
column8: Modify protocol language to reflect extract instead of posting

column3: Creation and posting of Average annual DLF
column8: ERCOT is not 'posting' an average annual DLF; Requirement should be removed from protocol since no formula was included.
Correct formula to reflect intervals during a leap year
System not designed to calculate compensation.
Current system design uses a simple capacity multiplied by a fee to determine payment.  The protocol has a more complex formula which uses a rolling unit availability factor.

column3: Uninstructed Deviation Tolerance Limit and Zonal Application
column8: System meets desired design, but not reflected in Protocols
Ramp should be considered part of instructions.

column3:
MERGED WITH PIP110.
SCE for Load Resources
OOME for Loads acting as a Resource
column8: The calculation for OOME only takes instructions to generators into account. There is no provision for Loads acting as a Resource in the OOME market.

column3: Cost allocation of defaulting AS providers
column8: There is no defined settlement process for this transaction, and no indication of receiving default information from Package 1. The standard mechanism of uplifting costs to load would apply for any procured AS.
Energy Payments for OOM UP does not incorporate Bid Price. Words in protocol are inconsistent with formula
Formula is not consistent with RMR Agreeement
No design for support of Sychronous Condenser Service

This formula is set up as a payment to provider, however, the provider will have already been paid in the Balancing Energy Market. There is no language under Resource Imbalance excluding RMR units, thus implying payment for their energy has already occurred.  This should be set up as money going back to ERCOT.
Formula is not consistent with Black Start Agreeement
Formula missing variable need for full allocation

Language clarification: Balancing energy service up bids consist of monotonically increasing ordered pairs ($/MWh, MW). Balancing energy service down bids consist of monotonically decreasing ordered pairs ($/MWh, MW).
Langauge clarification: information is posted by ERCOT, but not using the Messaging System
Price substitution is not supported by the system
Langauage between two sections seems to contradict

column3: Association of BE Bids with RPRS
column8: This concept was not included in the July 27th protocols and the system does not associate Balancing Energy bids with RPRS.
Not designed to be posted publically, but is being developed; under review with vendor

column3: Deployed Non-spin at 95% of BE Stack
column8: SOW requires user/ERCOT adjustable percentage to initiate deployment; No immediate wording changes required.

column4: Partial.  Pending further review w/ Vendor

column8: AS Bids are not included in the Balanced Schedule; but awarded bids should be included in updated schedules.
Current design does not check whether the total planned generation in the combined Resource Plan of the joint Resource representative QSE is greater than the actual generator’s capacity
Wording clarified
AS Obligations are currently assigned at the QSE level

column3: Notice of Balancing Energy Down Requirements
column8: Current design does not provide a notification to QSEs of Mandatory BES Down bid percentage requirements.
Loss factors are being posted; however, no direct notification is given to a QSE
System does not support expiration times for bids

column3: Removing a portion of RPRS bids
column8: Not supported
No special treatment for submission of RMR data
System does not support Responsibility Transfer Schedules.  For Dynamic Schedules, only the designation of bilateral schedules being dynamic is supported.

No visual presentation of Merit Order Stack: ESCA clarified "the system clears the RPRS bids to minimize the RPRS procurement costs. System does not create Merit Orders." means that visualization of the merit order stack of the RPRS bids is not provided.
No direct notification, but posting
ESCA clarification: "Load area forecast" will not be published.
Does this timeline support the annual TCR Auction requirement?
Change to reflect design

System does not support bid premiums for Resource-specific settlement charges as specified.  Package 1 algorithms utilize premium in solving Local Congestion, but this data would need to be passed from Package 1 to Package 2 and included in Resource specific charges. Although Paid as Bid methodology was introduced in early August in Protocol review and included in open point issues, there is no calculation to pay for “Local Balancing Energy Premiums to Provider”. There is no mechanism in the current design for submitting unit specific premium bids. If #5 below is incorporated, a corresponding formula and charge type will need to be created. 
THREE PIP EXCERPTS

Possible Contradiction: NSRS is deployed ERCOT wide without indication of Congestion Zone.
TWO PIP EXCERPTS

column3: Plant vs. Resource Specific Output in OOME
column5:
RUG
2 - Improvement if changing; or
1 - Refinement if permanent language
column8: Rather than plant specific output, OOME will be based on the resource plan submitted by the QSE for the specific Resource given the OOM instruction

column3: Mismatched Schedules in Replacement Underscheduled Charge
column8: There is no design to implement the maximum mismatched schedule amount as part of this charge.
Funds collected from SCF are not used for BECSC
Language is inconsistent with formula
Formula correct; language correction necessary for consistentcy

There is no inclusion of load data per UFE zone, nor provision of any data at the UFE zone level, on the Settlement Statement since UFE is settled as part of Imbalance. These are billing determinants not presented on the statement

column3:
MERGED WITH PIP163
Variable clarification in BENA
column8: Formula correct; however, clarification on variables needed

column3: Variable clarification in ERCOT Admin Fees
column8: Formula correct; however, clarification on variables needed
Non-ERCOT fees can't be on the settlement statement, since statements go to QSEs

column3: Posting Declining OOMC and OOME Dispatch Instructions

column4: Partial pending additional language and RUG decision
column8: Larger implications when introducing the default QSE than we have currently considered.  Alternatives must be presented to RUG.  No drafted process on backup process.
Not supported in current system design;

column7:
Item 4 = Phase 1
Other items in Phase 2
column8: Wording Change
Current design will not support ERCOT making the Weather Zone assignment

column3: ESI ID information included on SET 814_04.
column8: The current version of 814-04 does not include all the required information.  System design based on current 814-04.  Cutover and conversion asks for station name rather than bus id.
The current design does not include a Portal/MIS equivalent for the 814_04 and 814_09

column3: Status of TX SET Change Control process on Concurrent Processing
column8: The TX SET transaction for concurrent processing is in change control review by TX SET.  Any change to current transactions formats will result in gap.

column4: Partial pending current language on Friday

column8: System meets desired design, but not reflected in Protocols
To be addressed by future change control group (PCP).
How should deviations from uncontrollable renewable resources be handled? To be addressed by market change control group (PCP).

column3: Pay as Bid for Local Replacement Capacity
column8: System does not support bid prices for local replacement reserve
Constant value supported, but not ability to reduce on # of calls in a time period; Vendor agreed to support

column2:
PIP Number: Unique Identifier for item; should be referenced in each area of protocols sections where language has been altered
PIP Name: Description of the PIP Item
Rec Doc Status: Status of the corresponding Reconciliation Document
Related Items: Other PIP Items that may be related
Criticality: Ranked assessment of implementation need, as described in a corresponding PIP Ranking document
Language Author: Primary author responsible for drafting changes to protocol language
Proposed Delivery Schedule: Recommended Phase for implementation of the item
